problem_text:
(Well-known problem). Let G be a finite soluble group, π(G) the set of primes dividing the order of G, and ν(G) the maximum number of primes dividing the order of some element. Does there exist a linear bound for |π(G)| in terms of ν(G)?
A. Moret´o
answer: Yes, it does (T. M. Keller, J. Algebra, 178, no. 2 (1995), 643–652).
